intro: Erigeron myosotoides, commonly known as blueweed or blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy blue to purple ray florets surrounding a central disk of yellow tubular flowers. It typically grows in moist to wet habitats such as marshes and pond edges. Erigeron myosotoides is often used in wetland restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and provide habitat for pollinators.
